item.title: Datomic is Free
item.description: - Datomic, a database software, is now available for free to all, with no licensing fees.

item.title: Steven Spielberg: 'No film should be revised' based on modern sensitivity
item.description: - Steven Spielberg criticized the idea of re-editing older films to appease modern audiences, expressing remorse over removing guns from a later edition of E.T.

item.title: As I am currently in a war zone, I don't have many options for cabling
item.description: - A question on Electrical Engineering Stack Exchange asks about using clothesline steel wire for AC and DC wiring in a war zone where options are limited.

item.title: Colorado governor signs tractor right-to-repair law opposed by John Deere
item.description: - Colorado Governor Jared Polis signed the first state law guaranteeing farmers a right to repair tractors and other equipment themselves or at independent repair shops.

item.title: Every web search result in Brave Search is now served by our own index
item.description: - Brave Search has exceeded 2.5 billion queries in its first year of operation.

item.title: Dropbox telemetry can't be disabled
item.description: - Dropbox uses telemetry to receive client-side logging, error reporting, and other metrics, which cannot be disabled via the desktop application.

item.title: Dropbox to reduce global workforce by about 16%, or 500 staff
item.description: - Dropbox will reduce its global workforce by 16% or 500 Dropbox employees due to slowing growth and the arrival of the AI era of computing - The company is streamlining its organizational structure to align with sustainable financial growth, efficiency, and flexibility to invest in the future.

item.title: A visual book recommender
item.description: -Author prefers used book stores over commercial options for book discovery due to skewed search suggestions towards newer books.

item.title: Even Apple employees hate Siri & are skeptical of its future, new report says
item.description: - This article is not connected to the title or topic.

item.title: Emerging Rust GUI libraries in a WASM world
item.description: - Rust's cross-platform support and WebAssembly integration have made it a popular choice for GUI development - Notable Rust GUI toolkits include Dioxus, Tauri, Xilem, Iced, and Egui - This post discusses four additional Rust GUI frameworks: KasKas, Slint, Sycamore, and Yew, as well as other tools like Bracket, Cursive, Vizia, Leptos, Perseus, SauronLibrary, MoonZoon, and Relm4.
